Package edu.towson.cis.cosc442.project3.vendingmachine

Class VendingMachine

java.lang.Object
edu.towson.cis.cosc442.project3.vendingmachine.VendingMachine
public class VendingMachine
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the vending machine module. You can put items in the vending machine, remove items from the vending machine, purchase items from the vending machine, and even get your change back. The vending machine has 4 slots and each slot holds 1 item. Once that item is bought, that slot is empty. The slots are referred to by their "code", which is a letter. These codes are "A" for the slot at index 0, "B" for the slot at index 1, "C" for the slot at index 2, and "D" for the slot at index 3.

  • Constructor Details

    • VendingMachine

      public VendingMachine()
      Default constructor for the vending machine. It sets all the entries in the itemArray to be null, corresponding to an empty vending machine. Postcondition: all entries in itemArray are null, balance set to be 0

  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public void addItem​(VendingMachineItem item, java.lang.String code) throws VendingMachineException
      Adds an item to the vending machine at the slot specified by the code. Precondition: The slot specified by the code must be empty Postcondition: The item is now at the slot specified by the code
      Parameters:
      item - The vending machine item object to add to the vending machine
      code - The code of where this item should be in the vending machine
      Throws:
      VendingMachineException - under the following conditions: 1. If you add an item to a slot that is already occupied. 2. If you add an item with an invalid code 3. If you add a null item

    • removeItem

      public VendingMachineItem removeItem​(java.lang.String code) throws VendingMachineException
      Removes an item from the vending machine given its code. Postcondition: If the code slot is not empty, the item in that slot is removed.
      Parameters:
      code - The code eg. "A" of the item in the vending machine
      Returns:
      The item occupying the slot with the given code.
      Throws:
      VendingMachineException - If the slot at the specified code is empty and if the code is invalid

    • insertMoney

      public void insertMoney​(double amount) throws VendingMachineException
      Function to put money into the vending machine. Precondition: amount >= 0 or amount != -0 Postcondition: balance is now the previous balance + amount.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount of money to put in the vending machine
      Throws:
      VendingMachineException - Throws a VendingMachineException if amount is less than 0

    • getBalance

      public double getBalance()
      Returns the amount of change the user has in the vending machine. Note that this simply returns the amount and does not actually give back the change to the user. Precondition: balance >= 0; Note that the vending machine should start with a 0 balance. Postcondition: the balance is >= 0 and remains the same as it was before the function was called.
      Returns:
      The balance in the vending machine

    • makePurchase

      public boolean makePurchase​(java.lang.String code)
      This function attempts to purchase the item with the given code from the vending machine. Precondition: balance >= 0 Postcondition: The amount of the item is subtracted from the balance
      Parameters:
      code - The code for the item from the vending machine
      Returns:
      Returns true if there is enough money to make the purchase. Returns false if not enough money is put into the vending machine to make the purchase. Also returns false if the code is for an empty slot.

    • returnChange

      public double returnChange()
      Returns the amount of change in the machine and sets the balance to 0. Precondition: balance >= 0 Postcondition: balance = 0
      Returns:
      The amount of change in the machine
